definition: the feel (of sth touched with the hand)/(textiles) handle
hand/(formal) to hold/person engaged in certain types of work/person skilled in certain types of work/personal(ly)/convenient/classifier for skill/CL:雙|双[shuang1],隻|只[zhi1]
to feel/to move/to touch/to affect/feeling/emotion/(suffix) sense of ~

sentences.english: The products made of well-selected wool feel soft (have a soft feel).
sentences.chinese: 用料上乘的羊毛製品，手感柔軟。

sentences.english: Micro-channels filled with different materials in order to increase the speed and feeling.
sentences.chinese: 微坑道填充不同的材料以提高速度和手感。

sentences.english: This paper is smooth to the touch.
The GR223 grip has great flexibility with a protective membrane layer that adds softness and comfort.
sentences.chinese: 伸縮彈性好，具有護膜的握把膠，手感柔軟舒服。

sentences.english: Uncle Feel, Are you serious, or just kidding?
sentences.chinese: 叔叔手感，你是稀瑞耳屎先生還是賈斯特。雞丁？

sentences.english: Fold back the cover and read comfortably with just one hand.
sentences.chinese: 反折的覆蓋面和閱讀只有一個手感舒適。

sentences.english: The quality is superior, yet the price is very reasonable. It feels soft and smooth.
sentences.chinese: 該產品質優價廉，手感柔軟光滑。

sentences.english: This quality does have sueded face and brushed back and soft handfeel which we like.
sentences.chinese: 這個品質絨布的正面爲仿皮，背面爲拉絨，手感柔軟。

sentences.english: Because An more expensive racket only gives you more comfortable hand feelings!
sentences.chinese: 因爲貴點的球拍僅僅給你提供了更舒適的手感。

sentences.english: The proposal buys those feel exquisite, of withy function beautiful.
sentences.chinese: 建議購買那些手感細膩，柔韌性能佳的。

sentences.english: My skin texture has improved to feel soft and silky without any greasiness.
sentences.chinese: 我的皮膚紋理有改進，手感柔軟，沒有任何油膩柔滑。

sentences.english: Our TW playtesters found a comfortable response with lots of feel and control with this racquet.
sentences.chinese: 在實際使用會感受到這支球拍的良好控球及舒適手感。

sentences.english: It is cool to the touch and very absorbent .
sentences.chinese: 它的手感非常好並且非常吸汗。

sentences.english: The fibre whiteness is better and lofty, has no bast-fibre scratchiness.
sentences.chinese: 白度好，手感柔軟，無麻類纖維的刺癢感。

sentences.english: Craquelure is even and clear. Do not lose varnish. Smooth handle.
sentences.chinese: 裂紋效果明顯均勻，不掉漆，手感平整。

sentences.english: Cotton sateen fabric feels soft and smooth on the skin.
sentences.chinese: 棉緞面料手感柔軟，皮膚光滑。

definition: front sight (firearms)/the zero point indicator marked on a steelyard
(military) line of troops encircling an enemy position/(telephony) outside line/(basketball) outside the three-point line
opening (chess etc)/early stage of game, match, work, activity etc
to attack/to assault/to go on the offensive/attack/assault/offense (sports)
half of a game or contest/half-court
not up to scratch/subpar/off/gone awry/(of an instrument) to be out of kilter/(of a forecast) to be off the mark
to hit the target with one's throw/(basketball) to score
